findings.title: Blacklist can be bypassed
findings.description: Any blacklisted user can pass the check by using approve and require(tokenBlacklist[from] == false); in function.

findings.title: Token supply is not fixed
findings.description: Token supply can be changed at the behest of the token's owner.

findings.title: The blacklistAddress function has been omitted
findings.description: The blacklistAddress function is still present but not used anywhere.

findings.title: Improper error handling
findings.description: E.g. Using transferFrom without proper error handling.

findings.title: Tokens can be minted or burned
findings.description: Most token functionality is restricted when the contract is paused, however there is no restriction on mint and burn functions.

findings.title: Pragma Version not fixed
findings.description: It is a good practice to lock the solidity version for a live deployment (use 0.8.0 instead of ^0.8.0).

findings.title: Compiler version is too old
findings.description: The compiler version used may be too old and may result in issues such as increased bytecode size.

findings.title: Lack of unit tests
findings.description: There is a lack of unit tests with at least 98% coverage.
